channel.title: CiTR -- Inkstuds
channel.description: Inkstuds is the Citr's answer to the wonderful world of comix. Hosted by Robin McConnell and rotated cast of sidekicks, Inkstuds explores the underbelly of the comic world, interviewing some of today's top creators. Inkstuds focuses on underground and indy comix from publishers like Fantagraphics, Top Shelf, Drawn and Quarterly and more. Each week, we interview a different creator to get their unique perspective on comix and discuss thier own interesting and upcoming works. No creator too big or too small to be interviewed. The talent interviewed, ranges from the legends of alternative comix, to some kid who has only put out a couple of mini's, all with something new and interesting to share to the reading public.
channel.itunes:summary: Inkstuds is the Citr's answer to the wonderful world of comix. Hosted by Robin McConnell and rotated cast of sidekicks, Inkstuds explores the underbelly of the comic world, interviewing some of today's top creators. Inkstuds focuses on underground and indy comix from publishers like Fantagraphics, Top Shelf, Drawn and Quarterly and more. Each week, we interview a different creator to get their unique perspective on comix and discuss thier own interesting and upcoming works. No creator too big or too small to be interviewed. The talent interviewed, ranges from the legends of alternative comix, to some kid who has only put out a couple of mini's, all with something new and interesting to share to the reading public.
channel.itunes:author: CiTR 101.9 Vancouver
channel.itunes:subtitle: Inkstuds is the CiTR answer to the wonderful world of comix.

item.title: inkstuds on 30-Jul-2009
item.description: Denis Kitchen chatting about harvey kurtzman
item.itunes:subtitle: Kurtzman

item.title: Broadcast on Thu 09-Jul-2009
item.description: Hi guys! In this show you will discover a new FRENCH local band, hey oui, french band from Vancouver... it does exist!!! Leoffenders is two musicians girls very talented. They do rock-pop music with attitude... Check this out... you'll be surprise...!!! Enjoy!!! Marie-Eve
item.itunes:subtitle: Leoffenders "live" on French Connection

item.title: Inkstuds on 14-Feb-2008
item.description: Rockin with the golems might swing.
item.itunes:subtitle: James Sturm

item.title: inkstuds on 31-Jan-2008
item.description: Brian and Pia joined us to discuss the end of their series Y the last man.
item.itunes:subtitle: Brian K Vaughn and Pia Guerra

item.title: Inkstuds on 10-Jan-2008
item.description: Jonathan is one of my favorite new faces in comix, and he should be yours as well.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jonathan Bennett

item.title: Inkstuds on 27-Dec-2007
item.description: What comix did Colin and I like this year. listen to find out.
item.itunes:subtitle: Year in review

item.title: Inkstuds on 13-Dec-2007
item.description: Frank is the guy who draws Cold Heat and Storeyville
item.itunes:subtitle: Frank Santoro

item.title: Inkstuds on 06-Dec-2007
item.description: That was one of funnest shows that I have done for awhile. Brian is the guy behind some great comix of dirty goodness.
item.itunes:subtitle: Brian Ralph

item.title: Inkstuds on 22-Nov-2007
item.description: John Bell joined us to discuss his book, Invaders from the North. It is a great book about the history of Canadian comix.
item.itunes:subtitle: John Bell and Invaders from the North

item.title: Inkstuds on 15-Nov-2007
item.description: Matt Kindt joined us to discuss his book, SuperSpy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Matt Kindt

item.title: Inkstuds on 08-Nov-2007
item.description: Patrick Rosenkranz joined the inkstuds for a discussion of the work of Greg Irons. Patrick authored the wonderful collection, You Call This Art?! A Greg Irons Retrospective.
item.itunes:subtitle: Greg Irons

item.title: Inkstuds on 01-Nov-2007
item.description: Adrian Tomine, author of Optic Nerve, joined the inkstuds today, to chat about his latest book, Shortcomings.
item.itunes:subtitle: Adrian Tomine

item.title: Inkstuds on 01-Nov-2007
item.description: Adrian Tomine, author of Optic Nerve, joined the inkstuds today, to chat about his latest book, Shortcomings.
item.itunes:subtitle: Adrian Tomine

item.title: Inkstuds on 18-Oct-2007
item.description: Jeet Heer and Chris Ware joined the inkstud boys to discuss the fine work of Frank King. His strips may be almost 90 years old, but they still resonate a really nice beauty and honesty.
item.itunes:subtitle: Frank King

item.title: Inkstuds on 11-Oct-2007
item.description: Cartoonist, Rod Filbrandt joined us to talk to us about his work and career as one of vancouver premier cartoonists. Check out last weeks Georgia Straight for his awesome cover art of Gordon Campbell.
item.itunes:subtitle: Rod Filbrandt

item.title: Inkstuds on 04-Oct-2007
item.description: Nick joined us to discuss his new book, Laika from First Second books. Its great piece of historical fiction about Laika the dog that went to space.
item.itunes:subtitle: Nick Abadzis

item.title: Inkstuds on 27-Sep-2007
item.description: Chris Staros and Brett Warnock joined the Inkstuds today to discuss 10 years of publishing Top Shelf books.
item.itunes:subtitle: Top Shelf

item.title: Inkstuds on 20-Sep-2007
item.description: David Heatley is the imaginative man behind the self published series Deadpan. His work is a nice mix of revealing autobiographix and surrealist dream comix.
item.itunes:subtitle: David Heatley

item.title: Inkstuds on 13-Sep-2007
item.description: Don and I discussed our favorite comix of the summer 2007. Lots great books discussed.
item.itunes:subtitle: What we like.

item.title: Inkstuds on 06-Sep-2007
item.description: Johnny has to be the funniest creator in comix. His stuff is so offensive on all sorts of levels, that I can barely stop laughing to be able to read more. It was a fun interview, and he is a pretty interesting guy. If you haven't read Angry Youth Comix, you should start soon.
item.itunes:subtitle: Johnny Ryan

item.title: Inkstuds on 16-Aug-2007
item.description: Farel joined us today to talk about Popgun War, comix, Meathaus and more. Farel will be coming vancouver for the Comix and Stories convention at Heritage Hall on August 26th.
item.itunes:subtitle: Farel Dalrymple

item.title: Inkstuds on 02-Aug-2007
item.description: Kim Deitch is one of the most important creators in comix today. He has been craft marvelous work for the last 40 years, and shows no sign of slowing down, only getting better.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kim Deitch

item.title: Inkstuds on 26-Jul-2007
item.description: Jim is an awesome artist that has been doing some great stuff for Fantagraphics. His latest book is called Beasts and Priests is a collection of his portrait work that is sure to please the most discriminating eye.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jim Blanchard

item.title: Inkstuds on 19-Jul-2007
item.description:
Joe Chiappetta joined us to talk about his comic, Silly Daddy. Here is how he describes his comix - My life is an action-packed adventure as a Christian husband, father of three and a cartoonist. Imagine Van Gogh with a wife and kids today. Or cross Peanuts with the movie Nacho Libre. That's Silly Daddy, the Xeric Award winning comic, established 1991. Parenting has never been more profound, silly or profoundly silly.
It was a fun chat, Joe has been doing comix for many years and is currently celebrating Silly Daddy's sweet 16 birthday.
item.itunes:subtitle: Silly Daddy

item.title: Inkstuds on 12-Jul-2007
item.description: Fresh on tour for his latest album, Your Mom's Favorite DJ, Kid Koala joined me to talk about comix. He did a great graphic novel called Nufonia Must Fall. He was awesome to talk to and I am looking forward to his next book. Take a listen to hear what he has to say about it.
item.itunes:subtitle: Kid Koala

item.title: Inkstuds on 05-Jul-2007
item.description: This week I played an interview I conducted a couple of weeks ago, with Dr. Daniel Wilson, about his latest book, Where's My Jetpack. Daniel is a really smart interesting engaging guy, and superfun to interview. This is probably the geekiest interview I have done, but thats ok.
item.itunes:subtitle: Daniel Wilson

item.title: inkstuds on 28-Jun-2007
item.description: Luke Ramsey and Jim Stoten joined us to talk about comix art and fun. Jim is a cartoonist from England that has come to town to partake in Luke's artist residency project on Pender Island. They are both super talented artist and are doing some really nice looking work.
item.itunes:subtitle: The Islands Fold

item.title: Inkstuds on 14-Jun-2007
item.description: Barron Storey is one of the most influential people that I have had the pleasure to talk to. He has been teaching for many years, and counts some of the top creators in comix as former pupils. Those that have had the fortune of being students of Barron, include, Kent Williams, George Pratt, Peter Kuper, Seth Tobocman, Daniel Clowes and many more. His new book, Life After Black, is a reproduction of one of his incredible personal journals. It is an incredible testament to his talent, and well worth checking out.
item.itunes:subtitle: Barron Storey

item.title: Inkstuds on 07-Jun-2007
item.description: John Porcellino has been putting together King Cat Comics for the last 18 years. His latest book, King Cat Classix, is a massive tome of awesomeness, collecting the best of from the first 50 issues.
item.itunes:subtitle: John Porcellino

item.title: inkstuds on 31-May-2007
item.description: During his world wide tour, Scott McCloud joined us to discuss his books, comix and more. Scott is one of the smartest guys in comix, and is really pushing it forward as a critical media that merits discussion as an artform.
item.itunes:subtitle: Scott McCloud

item.title: Inkstuds on 24-May-2007
item.description: We were lucky enough to be able to meet up with Ron while he was in town with his band, Lavender Diamond. Ron is the guy behind some really interesting inovative comix. Some titles that you should check out are, Yeast Hoist, Awake Field and Skeeber Bee-Bye.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ron Rege Jr.

item.title: inkstuds on 17-May-2007
item.description: Melinda is the talented lady behind the artwork in Lost Girls. Lost Girls is an epic journey of smutty goodness involving Alice from Alice in wonderland, Wendy from Peter Pan and Dorothy from The Wizard of Oz. They all meet in a hotel in Austria, right before the breakout of the first world war. The 3 ladies of different ages, find comfort in each other, and what follows is nearly 300 pages of beautifully drawn, poetic fantasy. As well as Lost Girls, Melinda was also involded in the underground comix scene in San Francisco in the 1970's.
item.itunes:subtitle: Melinda Gebbie

item.title: inkstuds on 17-May-2007
item.description: Melinda is the talented lady behind the artwork in Lost Girls. Lost Girls is an epic journey of smutty goodness involving Alice from Alice in wonderland, Wendy from Peter Pan and Dorothy from The Wizard of Oz. They all meet in a hotel in Austria, right before the breakout of the first world war. The 3 ladies of different ages, find comfort in each other, and what follows is nearly 300 pages of beautifully drawn, poetic fantasy. As well as Lost Girls, Melinda was also involded in the underground comix scene in San Francisco in the 1970's.
item.itunes:subtitle: Melinda Gebbie

item.title: Inkstuds on 10-May-2007
item.description: Gary Groth and Kim Thompson are the guys that brought us the Comics Journal and Fantagraphics. Together, they have injected a critical attitude towards the wonderful world of comix, pushing it forward as an artform. Fantagraphics has published some of the best in alternative comix and continues to be a very important publisher.
item.itunes:subtitle: Gary Groth and Kim Thompson

item.title: Inkstuds on 03-May-2007
item.description: Ed Piskor is a new guy on the scene, making some awesome comix. He is currently collaborating with Harvey Pekar on a couple of projects. As well, Ed makes some great mini's.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ed Piskor

item.title: Inkstuds on 26-Apr-2007
item.description: This week, we were joined by comix superstar Tim Sale. Tim has been a recognizable talent in comix for the last 18 years. From his humble beginnings on Grendel, to his ground breaking run on Batman with frequent collaborator Jeph Loeb, to his current work behind the scenes in the popular TV show, Heroes, Tim has continued to excel in his craft. I have been a big fan for years and am always more than happy to see some new stuff by him.
item.itunes:subtitle: Tim Sale discusses his art and comix

item.title: Inkstuds on 19-Apr-2007
item.description: Today I was played an interview I did with Marc Bell, Owen Plummer, Jason Mclean, and Mark Delong about Nog A Dod, and the fine world of psychedoolia. It was recorded at Vancouvers lovely Ovaltine, right in the heart of the ghetto.
item.itunes:subtitle: Nog a Dod

item.title: Inkstuds on 12-Apr-2007
item.description: First Second Books are publishing some of the most interesting and important new comix right now. only a year old in the publishing game, First Second has already established itself as one of the premiere publishers of fine comix. Mark was kind enough to join us for a chat about their books, vision, and future. If you don't own any First Second books yet, go out and look for some, the line is very diverse, so everyone will find a book that speaks to there tastes. http://firstsecondbooks.com/
item.itunes:subtitle: Mark Siegel and First Second Books and Comics

item.title: Inkstuds on 05-Apr-2007
item.description: This weeks guest is Al Columbia. Al is the mastermind behind Biologic Show, Doghead, Orange Sunshine, Pim and Francie and much much more. I am a huge fan of his work, and look forward to the collection of work he is putting together for Fantagraphics. Check out the new Mome for some new art by him, or his website, www.alcolumbia.com.
item.itunes:subtitle: Al Columbia

item.title: Inkstuds on 29-Mar-2007
item.description: Ellen is the very talented artist behind one of my favorite collection of 2006, I Love Led Zeppelin. Its a collection of fun filthy collaborations and how to manuals for the subversive.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ellen Forney

item.title: Inkstuds on 22-Mar-2007
item.description: This weeks creative guest was Liz Prince. She does some fantastic slice of life autobio comix. Her work is for the most part short gag strips, that are so cute, they are written with a unicorns horn.
item.itunes:subtitle: Liz Prince Rocks It

item.title: Inkstuds on 15-Mar-2007
item.description: Gabrielle Bell is one of my favorite cartoonist out there right now. She does some excellent slice of life autobio work, and is developing into in my personal opinion being one of the more important modern creators. Check out her collection Lucky, from Drawn & Quarterly as well as short stories in the anthology Mome from Fantagraphics.
item.itunes:subtitle: Gabrielle Bell

item.title: Inkstuds on 08-Mar-2007
item.description: To celebrate International Womens Day, the Inkstuds were joined by creator, Roberta Gregory. She is one of the most important women in the creative comix sphere. Her legendary series, Naughty Bits, was a great example of an artist being able to do a series that is true to her creative ideals.
item.itunes:subtitle: Roberta Gregory

item.title: Inkstuds on 01-Mar-2007
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds hour of power, we took a break from the normal interviewing madness, to talk about comix we love that have come out over the last 6 months. We discuss work from Top Shelf, Drawn and Quarterly, Fantagraphics, Buenaventura Press, and more. Artist that we love, include, Anders Nilsen, Dan Zettwoch, and tons more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Its review time

item.title: Inkstuds on 22-Feb-2007
item.description: Shannon joined us in the studio to talk about her new anthology, Pet Noir. Its a great collection of true crime stories involving pets. Its a really fun read, that everyone should check out. It reminds me of DC's big book collections.
item.itunes:subtitle: Shannon O'leary

item.title: Inkstuds on 15-Feb-2007
item.description: Wow, this one is awesome. Jeff Smith, the creator of Bone, joined us this week to chat about his new Shazam series, and of course his epic work, Bone. It was really neat, because we got into all sorts of insites to his work. Jeff is a master of his craft and his latest book, Shazam - Monster Society of Evil, is one of my favorite comix of the year so far. Check it out, or else.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jeff Smith makes great interview

item.title: Inkstuds on 08-Feb-2007
item.description: Joe and Sean are a couple of talented kids destined for greatness. I have been a fan of their prospective works for quite sometime, and you should be as well.
item.itunes:subtitle: Sean Esty and Joseph Bergin the 3rd

item.title: inkstuds on 01-Feb-2007
item.description: Today I was joined by Matt Loux, author of SideScrollers, an awesome graphic novel of teenage adolescent fun, without a touch of angst. Its a great book, and Matt was a fun guy to talk to.
item.itunes:subtitle: Matt Loux

item.title: Inkstuds on 25-Jan-2007
item.description: This week I was joined by K. Thor Jensen, author and artist of Red Eye/Black Eye, the latest book to come out by alternative comix. We had a little technical difficulty for the first 15 minutes, but after that, Thor rocked the mic.
item.itunes:subtitle: K. Thor Jensen brings the pain

item.title: Inkstuds on 18-Jan-2007
item.description: This week, we were joined by Dennis P. Eichhorn, author of alternative comic staple Real Stuff. Dennis's work is awesome, and extremely influential in the world of autobio comix. And the man has more great tales than you can imagine.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dennis Eichhorn is Real Fun on the Inkstuds show

item.title: Inkstuds on 11-Jan-2007
item.description: Today we were supposed to be doing an interview with Dan Nadel, the editor of the excellent Art Out of Time collection. Unfortunately Dan was only able to join us for the last 10 minutes. So for the rest of the show, Robert Dayton and I chatted about some of Dans work, comix, pop culture, and more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dan Nadel

item.title: Inkstuds on 04-Jan-2007
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds radio hour of fun, I was joined by Dave McCaig. Dave is master of comix colouring, with such awesome outputs under his belt including Ultimate Hulk vs. Wolverine, Nextwave, and thwack more. He also does the covers for the Batman Strikes comic series. His colouring jobs really stand out in the realm of comix, for his ability to expand beyond the mundane colour palate, and go beyond.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave McCaig, Master of Crayons

item.title: Inkstuds on 04-Jan-2007
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds radio hour of fun, I was joined by Dave McCaig. Dave is master of comix colouring, with such awesome outputs under his belt including Ultimate Hulk vs. Wolverine, Nextwave, and thwack more. He also does the covers for the Batman Strikes comic series. His colouring jobs really stand out in the realm of comix, for his ability to expand beyond the mundane colour palate, and go beyond.
item.itunes:subtitle: Dave McCaig, Master of Crayons

item.title: Inkstuds on 28-Dec-2006
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds radio program of fun, I was joined by Robin Bougie and Corey MacDaniel to chat about comix and Corey's immigrant exprerience. We listen to music and talk about some great comix.
item.itunes:subtitle: Year end rap up with Corey MacDaniel

item.title: Inkstuds on 21-Dec-2006
item.description: Drippytown is a local anthology put together by Julian Lawrence and Ted Dave featuring some of Vancouver's best and brightest. We also featuring some music by Julian, including Points Grey a project he is involved in with Dan Bejar and Robert Dayton.
item.itunes:subtitle: Drippytown Fun

item.title: Inkstuds on 07-Dec-2006
item.description: this week was supposed to be the interview i did with Jacob Covey, and Justin B. Williams about the Beasts collection, but i dont know if the whole thing turned out.
item.itunes:subtitle: beasts

item.title: Inkstuds on 30-Nov-2006
item.description: Today, I was luckily enough to be able to have a chance to interview Ivan Brunetti. Ivan recently edited a comix anthology for Yale Press, that is one of the best recent collections of comix goodness. Ivan is also the mastermind of the Schizo series from Fantagraphic books, a series full of goodness. and look forward to his collection, coming out in the new year, Misery Loves Comedy.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ivan Brunetti makes good books

item.title: Inkstuds on 23-Nov-2006
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds show, I played a fine selection of music all by comic artists. Creators featured include, Wendypants and K. Thor Jensen from Music for Girls, Peter Bagge and Eric Reynolds with the Action Suits, Robert Dayton and Julian Lawrence with July Fourth Toilet, Mary Fleener with the Wigbillies, some Robert Crumb and more. Less Talk, More Rock.
item.itunes:subtitle: Comic artist can rock and roll

item.title: Inkstuds on 16-Nov-2006
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds, I chatted with breakthrough comix creator, Jaime Hernandez, half of the team behind Love and Rockets. Please excuse the requests for donations, but the others is valid until the 24th.
item.itunes:subtitle: Jaime Hernandez chats up the Inkstuds boyz

item.title: Inkstuds on 09-Nov-2006
item.description: This week on the inkstuds hour of fun, I chatted with Joe Ollman, about his latest book, This Will All End in Tears. It was a fun interview, and you should check out Joe, This saturday, Nov 11th, at the Helen Pitt Gallery at 8pm for his book launch.
item.itunes:subtitle: Joe Ollman, Bringing tears to us all

item.title: Inkstuds on 02-Nov-2006
item.description: I was joined by Ed Brisson, Publisher of the comix anthology, You Ain't No Dancer, a collection comprised of both Web and Print cartoonists. It was a fun show, and I was also joined by Jordyn Bochon and Colleen MacIsaac of the Radar Friends collective.
item.itunes:subtitle: You Ain't No Dancer

item.title: Inkstuds on 26-Oct-2006
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds radio hour of fun, I chatted with Mr. Ralph Steadman. Ralph as an artist has collaborated with Hunter S. Thompson for over 30 years. I got the chance to talk to Ralph while he is promoting his latest book, The Joke's Over, Memoirs of his time with Hunter. Ralph was an awesome guest and I feel honored to have been able to talk to him.
item.itunes:subtitle: Ralph Steadman, Gonzo Artist

item.title: Inkstudst on 19-Oct-2006
item.description: Colin and I were lucky enough, to be joined by Chester Brown, creator of Louis Riel, Yummy Fur, Playboy and more. Chester is a legend of comix goodness, and an super nice guy, I look forward to more work by him.
item.itunes:subtitle: Chester Brown joins the 'studs for an hour of chat of fun and good times

item.title: Inkstuds on 05-Oct-2006
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds radio hour, I was joined by local comix creator, Brian Fukushima. Brian is the creator of internet sensation, Job Goblin, which you can check out at http://www.bottomlesspop.com/.
item.itunes:subtitle: Finding the end of the Bottomless Pop

item.title: Inkstuds on 28-Sep-2006
item.description: I was joined by Robin Konstibaris for an interview with Renee French, the talented creator of The Ticking, Soap Lady and more. Check out her website at http://www.reneefrench.com or http://www.topshelfcomix.com.
item.itunes:subtitle: Interview with Renee French

item.title: Inkstuds on 21-Sep-2006
item.description: This week on the Inkstuds show, Colin and I talked about all of the comix that we have picked up over the last 6 months and loved. Some titles included are, Fun Home by Alison Bechdel, Wars End by Joe Sacco, Sequential by Paul Hornschemier, the Latest Drawn and Quarterly showcasr and much more. Next week, we talk with Renee French.
item.itunes:subtitle: yaking about new awesome books
